framework.name: Symfony_1/14/15 10:17 AM_s

command.name: help
command.help:
The help command displays help for a given command:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console help list

You can also output the help in other formats by using the --format option:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console help --format=xml list

To display the list of available commands, please use the list command.

Options:
--xmlTo output help as XML
--formatTo output help in other formats
--rawTo output raw command help
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug.
--version(-V)Display this application version.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--shell(-s)Launch the shell.
--process-isolationLaunch commands from shell as a separate process.
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

option.name: --format
option.help: To output help in other formats

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug.

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question.

option.name: --process-isolation
option.help: Launch commands from shell as a separate process.

command.name: list
command.help:
The list command lists all commands:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console list

You can also display the commands for a specific namespace:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console list test

You can also output the information in other formats by using the --format option:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console list --format=xml

It's also possible to get raw list of commands (useful for embedding command runner):

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console list --raw

Options:
--xmlTo output list as XML
--rawTo output raw command list
--formatTo output list in other formats

option.name: --format
option.help: To output list in other formats

command.name: assets:install
command.help:
The assets:install command installs bundle assets into a given
directory (e.g. the web directory).

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console assets:install web

A "bundles" directory will be created inside the target directory, and the
"Resources/public" directory of each bundle will be copied into it.

To create a symlink to each bundle instead of copying its assets, use the
--symlink option (will fall back to hard copies when symbolic links aren't possible:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console assets:install web --symlink

To make symlink relative, add the --relative option:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console assets:install web --symlink --relative


Options:
--symlinkSymlinks the assets instead of copying it
--relativeMake relative symlinks
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug.
--version(-V)Display this application version.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--shell(-s)Launch the shell.
--process-isolationLaunch commands from shell as a separate process.
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

option.help: Symlinks the assets instead of copying it

command.name: broadway:event-store:schema:drop
command.help:

command.name: cache:clear
command.help:
The cache:clear command clears the application cache for a given environment
and debug mode:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console cache:clear --env=dev
php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console cache:clear --env=prod --no-debug


Options:
--no-warmupDo not warm up the cache
--no-optional-warmersSkip optional cache warmers (faster)

command.name: cache:warmup
command.help:
The cache:warmup command warms up the cache.

Before running this command, the cache must be empty.

This command does not generate the classes cache (as when executing this
command, too many classes that should be part of the cache are already loaded
in memory). Use curl or any other similar tool to warm up
the classes cache if you want.


Options:
--no-optional-warmersSkip optional cache warmers (faster)

--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug.

command.name: config:dump-reference
command.help:
The config:dump-reference command dumps the default configuration for an
extension/bundle.

Either the extension alias or bundle name can be used:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console config:dump-reference framework
php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console config:dump-reference FrameworkBundle

With the format option specifies the format of the configuration,
this is either yaml or xml.
When the option is not provided, yaml is used.

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console config:dump-reference FrameworkBundle --format=xml


Options:
--formatThe format, either yaml or xml
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug.
--version(-V)Display this application version.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--shell(-s)Launch the shell.
--process-isolationLaunch commands from shell as a separate process.
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

option.help: The format, either yaml or xml

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug.

option.help: Do not ask any interactive question.

option.name: --process-isolation

command.name: debug:container
command.help:
The debug:container command displays all configured public services:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console debug:container

To get specific information about a service, specify its name:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console debug:container validator

By default, private services are hidden. You can display all services by
using the --show-private flag:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console debug:container --show-private

Use the --tags option to display tagged public services grouped by tag:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console debug:container --tags

Find all services with a specific tag by specifying the tag name with the --tag option:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console debug:container --tag=form.type

Use the --parameters option to display all parameters:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console debug:container --parameters

Display a specific parameter by specifying his name with the --parameter option:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console debug:container --parameter=kernel.debug


Options:
--show-privateUsed to show public *and* private services
--tagShows all services with a specific tag
--tagsDisplays tagged services for an application
--parameterDisplays a specific parameter for an application
--parametersDisplays parameters for an application
--formatTo output description in other formats
--rawTo output raw description
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug.
--version(-V)Display this application version.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--shell(-s)Launch the shell.
--process-isolationLaunch commands from shell as a separate process.
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

option.help: Used to show public *and* private services

command.name: debug:translation
command.help:
The debug:translation command helps finding unused or missing translation
messages and comparing them with the fallback ones by inspecting the
templates and translation files of a given bundle.

You can display information about bundle translations in a specific locale:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console debug:translation en AcmeDemoBundle

You can also specify a translation domain for the search:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console debug:translation --domain=messages en AcmeDemoBundle

You can only display missing messages:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console debug:translation --only-missing en AcmeDemoBundle

You can only display unused messages:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console debug:translation --only-unused en AcmeDemoBundle


Options:
--domainThe messages domain
--only-missingDisplays only missing messages
--only-unusedDisplays only unused messages
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug.
--version(-V)Display this application version.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--shell(-s)Launch the shell.
--process-isolationLaunch commands from shell as a separate process.
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

option.name: --verbose
option.help: Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug.

option.name: --no-interaction
option.help: Do not ask any interactive question.

option.name: --process-isolation
option.help: Launch commands from shell as a separate process.

command.name: doctrine:database:create
command.help:
The doctrine:database:create command creates the default
connections database:

php app/console doctrine:database:create

You can also optionally specify the name of a connection to create the
database for:

php app/console doctrine:database:create --connection=default

Options:
--connectionThe connection to use for this command

command.name: doctrine:database:drop
command.help:
The doctrine:database:drop command drops the default connections
database:

php app/console doctrine:database:drop

The --force parameter has to be used to actually drop the database.

You can also optionally specify the name of a connection to drop the database
for:

php app/console doctrine:database:drop --connection=default

Be careful: All data in a given database will be lost when executing
this command.

Options:
--connectionThe connection to use for this command
--forceSet this parameter to execute this action
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug.
--version(-V)Display this application version.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--shell(-s)Launch the shell.
--process-isolationLaunch commands from shell as a separate process.
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

option.help: The connection to use for this command

option.help: Set this parameter to execute this action

option.name: --verbose

option.name: --process-isolation

command.name: doctrine:query:sql
command.help:
The doctrine:query:sql command executes the given SQL query and
outputs the results:

php app/console doctrine:query:sql "SELECT * from user"

Options:
--depthDumping depth of result set.
--connectionThe connection to use for this command
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug.
--version(-V)Display this application version.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--shell(-s)Launch the shell.
--process-isolationLaunch commands from shell as a separate process.
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

command.name: router:dump-apache
command.help:
The router:dump-apache dumps all routes as Apache rewrite rules.
These can then be used with the ApacheUrlMatcher to use Apache for route
matching.

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console router:dump-apache


Options:
--base-uriThe base URI
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug.

--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.

--shell(-s)Launch the shell.
--process-isolationLaunch commands from shell as a separate process.
--env(-e)The Environment name.

command.name: router:match
command.help:
The router:match shows which routes match a given request and which don't and for what reason:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console router:match /foo
or
php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console router:match /foo --method POST --scheme https --host symfony.com --verbose


Options:
--methodSets the HTTP method
--schemeSets the URI scheme (usually http or https)
--hostSets the URI host
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug.

--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.

--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

command.name: translation:update
command.help:
The translation:update command extract translation strings from templates
of a given bundle or the app folder. It can display them or merge the new ones into the translation files.
When new translation strings are found it can automatically add a prefix to the translation
message.

Example running against a Bundle (AcmeBundle)
php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console translation:update --dump-messages en AcmeBundle
php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console translation:update --force --prefix="new_" fr AcmeBundle

Example running against app messages (app/Resources folder)
php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console translation:update --dump-messages en
php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console translation:update --force --prefix="new_" fr


Options:
--prefixOverride the default prefix
--output-formatOverride the default output format
--dump-messagesShould the messages be dumped in the console
--forceShould the update be done
--no-backupShould backup be disabled
--cleanShould clean not found messages
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug.
--version(-V)Display this application version.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--shell(-s)Launch the shell.
--process-isolationLaunch commands from shell as a separate process.
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

command.name: yaml:lint
command.help:
The yaml:lint command lints a YAML file and outputs to STDOUT
the first encountered syntax error.

You can validate the syntax of a file:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console yaml:lint filename

Or of a whole directory:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console yaml:lint dirname
php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console yaml:lint dirname --format=json

Or all YAML files in a bundle:

php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console yaml:lint @AcmeDemoBundle

You can also pass the YAML contents from STDIN:

cat filename | php /Users/mhightower/PhpstormProjects/ddd_broadway/app/console yaml:lint


Options:
--formatThe output format
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug.
--version(-V)Display this application version.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--shell(-s)Launch the shell.
--process-isolationLaunch commands from shell as a separate process.
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.

framework.help:
Usage:
[options] command [arguments]


Options:
--no-debugSwitches off debug mode.
--version(-V)Display this application version.
--ansiForce ANSI output.
--process-isolationLaunch commands from shell as a separate process.
--no-ansiDisable ANSI output.
--env(-e)The Environment name.
--shell(-s)Launch the shell.
--verbose(-v)Increase the verbosity of messages: 1 for normal output, 2 for more verbose output and 3 for debug.
--no-interaction(-n)Do not ask any interactive question.
--help(-h)Display this help message.
--quiet(-q)Do not output any message.

Available commands:
helpDisplays help for a command
listLists commands
assets:installInstalls bundles web assets under a public web directory
broadway:event-store:schema:dropDrops the event store schema
broadway:event-store:schema:initCreates the event store schema
cache:clearClears the cache
cache:warmupWarms up an empty cache
config:dump-referenceDumps the default configuration for an extension
debug:configDumps the current configuration for an extension
config:debugDumps the current configuration for an extension
debug:containerDisplays current services for an application
container:debugDisplays current services for an application
debug:event-dispatcherDisplays configured listeners for an application
debug:routerDisplays current routes for an application
router:debugDisplays current routes for an application
debug:translationDisplays translation messages informations
translation:debugDisplays translation messages informations
doctrine:database:createCreates the configured databases
doctrine:database:dropDrops the configured databases
doctrine:query:sqlExecutes arbitrary SQL directly from the command line.
router:dump-apacheDumps all routes as Apache rewrite rules
router:matchHelps debug routes by simulating a path info match
translation:updateUpdates the translation file
yaml:lintLints a file and outputs encountered errors
